attributes.action: Leave the EU using Article 24 W.T.O
attributes.additional_details: In the aftermath of Parliament’s rejection of the draft Withdrawal Agreement, there is a way forward for the Government which allows a smooth transition into a No Deal scenario after 29th March, if found necessary, and then allows the UK to negotiate its desired comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the EU without having to impose tariffs or quotas in the interim. There is a mechanism to ‘manage’ a No Deal scenario; one that works within existing WTO rules.
attributes.background:
Leavers support leaving the Eu using Article 24 W.T.O 
Parliament are not listening to the people,  they should respect and uphold the the referendum result and they are  not.
